channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaning lamppost outside 23A Selborne Road, 19th June
item.description:
A resident has contact me (as a local councillor) to say the lamppost outside 23A Selborne had been hit by a vehicle (the resident says a refuse truck) and is leaning. I haven’t seen this but would be grateful if it could be investigated urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selborne Road, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A van was seen to strike a pavement bollard whilst reversing, 19th June
item.description:
The bollard has been "checked" by a member of the public and appears to be still firmly attached to the pavement. But the council should check as an impact has taken place. Time of impact 07:07hrs 19.06.25 Time of reporting 08:16 19.06.25 Issue present approx 1 hour

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orange Street, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 5-9 penge high street, 19th June
item.description:
See attached. This is completely unacceptable. Someone from the council needs to step in here and do something about these flats. It’s disgraceful that this has been able to go on for so long. Please can someone take action and respond to residents as to what is being done here?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Bridge to Windmill Bridge Junction, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bench outside business, 19th June
item.description:
A local business has placed a bench outside (drilled into the concrete). People during the night sit out here and talk loudly, smoke, and drink which is disturbing local residents. We ask that you ask the business to remove the bench in the evenings
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Standard Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping and rats, 19th June
item.description:
Noticed that there is more fly tipping from local businesses. They also don’t place their rubbish properly in the bins or close them which causes them to overflow and rats to go in and out of bins.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Standard Place, Hackney, London

item.title: Urgent Action Needed on Sewage Vent Emissions, 19th June
item.description:
The nearby sewage vent emits foul-smelling gas, posing a serious health concern. Residents can’t open windows or breathe fresh air. This was reported last year but ignored. Action is urgently needed—this must be a council priority
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Northwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
